author: guitargeek
body:
This basically a follow up to https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/23767, where I fixed a thread-safety issue in the new Egamma MVA ID implementation by just moving the IDs out of the global cache of the producer.

I did not consider this as a permanent solution, because the MVA IDs with the large GBRForests should indeed not be replicated for each thread. Here I propose:

* To simply promote the MVAValueMapProducer to a global EDProducer to not duplicate the GBRForests
* To wrap the employed `StringCutObjectSelector<>` and `StringCutObjectFunction<>` into a little class together with a `std::mutex` to make their operator() thread safe
* Make the MultiToken thread safe so it can be used in global producers

The matrix tests pass and the changes were also a little bit battle tested with the multi-threaded ntuplizer in my MultileptonAnalysis.
title: Egamma IDs back to global cache
